intro: Euchaetis glomerata, commonly known as the clustered spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and showy, clustered inflorescences. The plant typically grows in open, sunny areas such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its small, yellowish flowers are surrounded by modified leaves called bracts, which give it a distinctive appearance. Euchaetis glomerata is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive foliage and unique floral structure.
